profile_data.summary:
As a dynamic Data Scientist, AI/ML Engineer, and Software Developer with over 4 years of experience, I specialize in delivering high-impact AI/ML models and deploying them into scalable, production-ready environments. Holding a Master's in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science from the University of Southern California, I possess a diverse technical skill set, with expertise spanning Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Big Data Analytics, and Cloud Computing.

My career includes notable achievements in model optimization, GPU acceleration, and full-stack development across multiple industries, including healthcare, energy, and geospatial analysis. My experience at organizations like Black Pearl Technology and MetLife highlights my proficiency in deploying scalable ML pipelines, leveraging cloud platforms such as AWS and Azure, and implementing CI/CD pipelines to ensure reliability and efficiency in production environments.

With strong expertise in Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, and AWS SageMaker, I also excel in automating workflows, optimizing models for performance, and collaborating cross-functionally to solve complex business problems using AI/ML. As a leader and mentor, I have guided teams through technical projects and achieved operational excellence.

I am passionate about driving innovation through AI/ML, exploring emerging technologies, and delivering results that create business value. I am currently seeking opportunities where I can further contribute to AI/ML innovations in scalable and impactful ways.

volunteer.role: Organizing Lead, Virtual Visit on Modern Physics - VVMP'2020
volunteer.description:
#ExploreBeyondBoundaries
Virtual Visit on Modern Physics at
IEEE BVM Student Branch [Gujarat Section]
IEEE BVM SB organized yet another flagship event under the ‘IEEE NPSS
- Nuclear & Plasma Sciences Society’ known as ‘Virtual Visit on Modern
Physics - VVMP 2020’ on 5, 6, 7, 12 & 13 September 2020. In this
unprecedented time of the pandemic, going beyond physical boundaries
with the modern-day technology and explore with experts from the finest
Laboratories / Institutions around the world.
The overall theme focused on enhancing the knowledge of students and
academic professionals in various domains of Modern Physics like
Nuclear & Plasma Sciences, Space Technologies, & Renewable Energy, etc.
Around 600 participants registered themselves in these virtual visit
sessions.
Highlights of Expert Speakers & Tracks:
1. Terahertz Radar Technology by Dr. Goutam Chattopadhyay,
Senior Scientist, NASA – JPL
2. James Webb Space Telescope by Dr. Matthew Greenhouse,
Astrophysicist, NASA Goddard Space Flight Centre
3. 'AstroSat': India's First Mission on Space by Dr. Arvind K.
Singh, Senior Scientist, ISRO, Ahmedabad, India
4. [VIRTUAL VISIT] to ATLAS Experiments at LHC, CERN,
Geneva by Dr. Steven Goldfarb & Dr. Clara Nellist,
Researchers, ATLAS Experiment at LHC, CERN
5. Wind Energy Systems at DTU (Technical University of
Denmark) by Ms. Cathy Suo, Head of the Division, Wind
Energy System, DTU
6. Plasma-based Technology for Future Particle Colliders by Dr.
Ligia Diana Amorim, Postdoctoral Scholar, Lawrence
Berkeley National Laboratory

https://vvmp-20.web.app/

projects.description: Developed a comprehensive Python script and Jupyter Notebook to explore Support Vector Machines (SVM) using both dual formulation and kernel tricks. Implemented manual SVM dual formulation to compute optimal weight vectors and decision boundaries. Enhanced the project with Scikit-Learn’s linear and kernel SVM models, leveraging Matplotlib for data visualization. This project highlights expertise in machine learning simulations, Python scripting, and advanced SVM techniques. 🔍📊 #MachineLearning #Python #SVM #DataScience #ScikitLearn #Matplotlib #DataVisualization
projects.title: 🚀 SVM Dual Formulation & Kernel Comparison Project 🚀

projects.description: Developed a series of Python-based simulations to explore key concepts in probability theory, including biased coin flips, random walks, and Monte Carlo methods. Visualized outcomes using matplotlib to estimate statistical properties like Pi, and demonstrated the Law of Large Numbers. This project showcases my expertise in Python scripting, statistical modeling, and data visualization, with a focus on applying Machine Learning principles to probabilistic simulations.
projects.title: Probabilistic Simulations & Monte Carlo Experiments

projects.description: Preprocessed DisGeNET dataset, capturing gene-disease associations and leveraging STRING PPI interactions. Evaluated GraphSAGE's inductive learning and GAT's attention mechanism architectures on varied datasets, with GAT consistently outperforming, achieving up to 0.857 AUC-ROC and 0.844 F1 scores in predicting gene-disease associations using GNNs.
projects.title: Gene-Disease Association Prediction Arch. using Graph Attention Network (GAT) and GraphSage

Data Operations Coordinator @ NFL | MS Data Science @ USC | UCLA Alum

projects.description:
● Consolidated development of a MySQL-based emulation for efficient dataset simulation, deploying SQLalchemy and pymysql, boosting data accessibility and reducing data storage and processing efforts by 50%.
● Designed an emulated distributed file system with a partition MapReduce strategy, improving dataset simulation & query response times by 30%. Analyzed LA housing dynamics to explore foreclosure rates and external variables.
● Led a database management project that aimed to shed light on the social inequality caused by foreclosures in the city.
● Cleaned and merged two large datasets containing over 600,000 records of foreclosed properties and crime incidents, and developed an emulated distributed file system and MySQL-based emulation to handle the large volume of data.
● Implemented a partition-based map and reduce algorithm and created an app for search and analytics that allowed for easy exploration of the datasets and identification of foreclosure trends and hotspots.
● Identified the zip codes with the highest concentration of foreclosures and examined external variables such as crime rates to better understand the factors influencing foreclosure rates.
● Results showed a clear correlation between crime rates and foreclosure rates, with zip codes with higher crime rates also having higher foreclosure rates, highlighting the need for targeted interventions in these areas.
Youtube VIDEO LINK: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=q3TGpaKt-UI
projects.title: Distributed File System with mySQL Emulation for Foreclosure Rates in Los Angeles Analysis

projects.description: Predicted and Classified Forest fires based on weather data collected from the regions. Tasked Feature Engineering to Multiply the feature and used PCA methods for the Selection of the concerned best features, which helped increase the size of the very small dataset provided. Tested Various Machine Learning Models like MSE, SVM, Perceptron, Logistic Regression, Kernel-NN, Random Forest, Decision Tree, etc. and proved with calculation with new features and dimensional Reduction- Perceptron performs the best and achieved an overall accuracy of 91%.
projects.title: Forest fires Classification & Prediction with various Models (On Algerian Forest Fires – UCI ML Datasets)
